intro: [WRONG START] Hieracium tmutolium, commonly known as the meadow hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its yellow-orange composite flowers and hairy, often glandular leaves. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils across Europe and parts of Asia. It has a basal rosette of leaves and produces a tall flowering stem with numerous small flower heads. Hieracium tmutolium is an annual or biennial herb that plays a role in supporting pollinators and maintaining soil stability.
